pageContext.claim: “How can it be possible that James Woods (and many others), a strong but responsible Conservative Voice, is banned from Twitter? Social Media & Fake News Media, together with their partner, the Democrat Party, have no idea the problems they are causing for themselves. VERY UNFAIR!”
pageContext.analysis: Twitter denies that Republicans are treated any differently than other users. There is no evidence -- but lots of conspiracy theories -- that Twitter is slanted against conservative voices. Twitter long has explained that follower figures fluctuate as the company takes action to remove fraudulent spam accounts. Outspoken conservative actor James Woods was banned from Twitter for more than a week for violating rules concerning abusive behavior after he tweeted: "If you try to kill the King, you best not miss’ #HangThemAll" - an apparent reference to the Mueller report. On May 9, Woods said he will no longer use Twitter after the platform deleted the tweet, which he refused to take down
